thread.title: Small investment to local pump station in Tipperary 'can improve the experience locally'
thread.title_full: Small investment to local pump station in Tipperary 'can improve the experience locally'

author: Reporter
title: Small investment to local pump station in Tipperary 'can improve the experience locally'
text:
Cllr Declan Burgess has issued a statement regarding the water pump station at Palmers Hill in Cashel.
Cllr Burgess says that the station becomes a point of failure in the town during water outages.
READ MORE: Work to start on next €2.9m phase of Carrick-on-Suir Regeneration Scheme in January
He said: "There has been a longstanding and unacceptable issue with the pump station at Palmers Hill. Each time there are water outages in Cashel, this station once again becomes a point of failure. The pump station serving Palmers Hill and the surrounding areas has experienced repeated electrical faults, leading to ongoing system failures.
"Uisce Éireann has been aware of these problems for a number of years, yet no meaningful investment or upgrade works have been carried out. This situation cannot continue.
READ MORE: St Angela’s Academy presents an evening of musical theatre at Source Arts Centre
"I am calling on Uisce Éireann to immediately prioritise and deliver the necessary upgrades to the Palmers Hill pump station to ensure a reliable and consistent water supply for residents. The residents here have endured these disruptions for far too long."
